bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Energy Efficiency Act;
ANSI means the American National Standards Institute;

applicable efficiency standard, in relation to an energy device, means each efficiency standard that applies to the energy device under section 7 [prescribed efficiency standards] or, if applicable, section 8 [early adoption of future efficiency standards];
ASTM means the American Society for Testing and Materials International;
ASTM C518-04 means ASTM standard ASTM C518-04 entitled Standard Test Method for Steady-State Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Heat Flow Meter Apparatus;
ASTM C518-10 means ASTM standard ASTM C518-10 entitled Standard Test Method for Steady-State Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Heat Flow Meter Apparatus;
BTU means British thermal units;
CIE means the Commission internationale de l'éclairage, or International Commission on Illumination;
CSA means the Canadian Standards Association;
designated tester, in relation to an energy device, means a person, agency or organization that, under section 4 [designated testers], is designated and authorized to verify the energy device;
efficiency standards table means a table referred to in section 2 [prescribed energy devices];
energy efficiency verification label means a label required under section 5 (1);
federal Act means the Energy Efficiency Act (Canada);
federal minister has the same meaning as "Minister" in the federal Act;
federal regulation means the Energy Efficiency Regulations, 2016 made under the federal Act;
IEC means the International Electrotechnical Commission;
ISO means the International Organization for Standardization;
ISO/IEC 17065 means ISO/IEC standard ISO/IEC 17065 entitled Conformity assessment — Requirements for bodies certifying products, processes and services;
label means a printed decal, stamped plate or other permanent marking;
manufactured fenestration product means an energy device referred to in column 1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27 [efficiency standards for manufactured fenestration products];
manufacturing information label means a label required under section 6 (1);
NFRC means the National Fenestration Rating Council;
RSI means an R-value expressed in SI units of metre squared Kelvin per watt, or m2×K/W;
verify means applying a testing procedure to determine whether an energy device meets an applicable efficiency standard.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed energy devices
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of the definition of "energy device" in section 1 of the Act, the products referred to in column 1 of the efficiency standards tables in the following sections are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 15 [efficiency standards for compact audio products, televisions, video products and consumer battery charging systems];
section 27 [efficiency standards for manufactured fenestration products];
section 30 [efficiency standards for household appliances];
section 34 [efficiency standards for heating, ventilation and air conditioning products];
section 38 [efficiency standards for water heaters];
section 41 [efficiency standards for lighting products];
section 47 [efficiency standards for general purpose electric motors];
section 54 [efficiency standards for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients];
section 63 [efficiency standards for notebook computers and portable all-in-one computers];
section 69 [efficiency standards for computer monitors];
section 74 [efficiency standards for high expandability computers, mobile workstations, small-scale servers and workstations].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 2 (3) (a) [exemption from section 2 (1) of Act] of the Act, the prescribed date for an energy device referred to in column 1 in an item of an efficiency standards table is the date set out in column 2 opposite the energy device.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Designated testers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, certification program means a program of verification using standard testing procedures.
For the purposes of verifying an energy device, the following persons, agencies or organizations are designated, and authorized as indicated, to make the verification:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: inspectors designated under section 3 (1) [inspection and testing] of the Act are authorized to verify any energy device;
persons or organizations accredited by the Standards Council of Canada as certification bodies are authorized to verify any energy device to which the certification relates;
agencies accredited by the NFRC as independent certification and inspection agencies are authorized to verify any manufactured fenestration product;
professional engineers, and architects authorized to practise in British Columbia, are authorized to verify the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: door slabs referred to in column 1 in item 1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27 [efficiency standards for manufactured fenestration products];
glazing products referred to in column 1 in item 2 of the efficiency standards table in section 27;
manufactured fenestration products, other than door slabs and glazing products referred to in subparagraphs (i) and (ii) of this paragraph, that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: are designed for a specific building, or
fall outside the scope of a certification program;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: certification bodies are authorized to verify any computer or computer monitor if the certification bodies

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are accredited under an International Accreditation Forum Multilateral Recognition Arrangement based on ISO/IEC 17065, and
maintain an internet accessible product listing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Professional engineers and architects referred to in subsection (2) (d) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: verify manufactured fenestration products referred to in subsection (2) (d) (iii) (A) of this section in the manner described in section 25 [efficiency standard exemption for manufactured fenestration products designed for specific buildings], and

verify manufactured fenestration products referred to in subsection (2) (d) (iii) (B) of this section in the manner described in section 26 [calculation of U-value for atypical manufactured fenestration products].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Energy efficiency verification label

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 2 (1) (b) [prescribed label] of the Act, every energy device, other than an energy device referred to in subsection (2) of this section, must have affixed to it an energy efficiency verification label that indicates, by way of a registered trademark, wordmark or symbol of a designated tester, that the designated tester has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: verified the energy device, and
determined that the energy device meets the applicable efficiency standards.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device in respect of which one of the following sections of this regulation applies:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 13 [label exemption for compact audio products, televisions and video products compliant with federal Act];
section 14 [label exemption for consumer battery charging systems with California label];
section 24 [label exemption for manufactured fenestration products designed for specific buildings];
section 29 [label exemption for clothes washers, dishwashers, refrigerators, combination refrigerator-freezers and freezers compliant with federal Act];
section 32 [label exemption for gas furnaces compliant with federal Act];
section 32.1 [label exemption for commercial gas boilers with reported information or compliant with federal Act];
section 36 [label exemption for water heaters compliant with federal Act];
section 39.2 [label exemption for certain lamps compliant with federal Act];
section 53 [label exemption for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients with certification report];
section 62 [label exemption for notebook computers and portable all-in-one computers with certification report];
section 68 [label exemption for computer monitors with certification report];
section 73 [label exemption for high expandability computers, mobile workstations, small-scale servers and workstations with certification report].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person placing an energy efficiency verification label on an energy device, other than an energy device to which section 33.2 [placement of label on vented gas fireplace heaters and vented decorative gas appliances] applies, must affix the label so that the label is easily and readily seen on the energy device without the need to remove any covering.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Manufacturing information label

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 2 (1) (b) [prescribed label] of the Act, the manufacturer of an energy device made in British Columbia, and the importer of an energy device not made in British Columbia, must affix to the energy device or the packaging of the energy device a manufacturing information label that sets out

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the manufacturer's name or identification, and
the date of manufacture or a date code.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person placing a manufacturing information label on the packaging of an energy device must affix the label so that the label can be easily and readily seen without the need to remove any covering.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed efficiency standards

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For an energy device referred to in column 1 in an item of an efficiency standards table,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the efficiency standards for the energy device are the applicable standards set out or referred to in column 4 opposite that energy device,

the testing procedures that must be used to determine whether the energy device meets an efficiency standard referred to in paragraph (a) are the applicable testing procedures set out or referred to in column 5 opposite the efficiency standard, and

subject to section 8 [early adoption of future efficiency standards], an efficiency standard referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection and the corresponding testing procedure referred to in paragraph (b) of this subsection apply to the energy device if the energy device is manufactured during the period set out in column 3 opposite that energy device.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the efficiency standard for a manufactured fenestration product referred to in section 25 [efficiency standard exemption for manufactured fenestration products designed for specific buildings] may be met by the method set out in that section,

the efficiency standard for a manufactured fenestration product referred to in section 26 [calculation of U-value for atypical manufactured fenestration products] may be met by the method set out in that section, and

in addition to meeting the efficiency standards referred to in subsection (1) (a) of this section, a fluorescent lamp ballast to which section 40 [additional efficiency standard for fluorescent lamp ballasts] applies must meet the efficiency standard referred to in subsection (2) of that section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Early adoption of future efficiency standards
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 2 [efficiency standards of energy devices] of the Act, if 2 or more items in an efficiency standards table refer to the same energy devices in column 1 and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one of the items in the efficiency standards table sets out an efficiency standard in column 4 and a corresponding testing procedure in column 5 that apply to the energy devices if they are manufactured during the period set out in column 3 opposite the energy devices, and

one or more of the other items in that efficiency standards table set out an efficiency standard in column 4 and a corresponding testing procedure in column 5 that would apply to the energy devices if they were manufactured after the period referred to in paragraph (a) of this section,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the efficiency standard for the energy devices referred to in paragraph (a) of this section may be met by meeting an efficiency standard referred to in paragraph (b) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Verification report

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, verification report means a report issued by a designated tester indicating that the designated tester has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: verified an energy device, and
determined that the energy device meets the applicable efficiency standards.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A verification report is evidence that an energy device meets the applicable efficiency standards.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption from Act and regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: The Act and this regulation do not apply to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who manufactures an energy device in British Columbia, or
a person who manufactures any thing in British Columbia that incorporates into it an energy device,

bcl:section.bcl:text: if that energy device or thing is manufactured for export from British Columbia.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Compact Audio Products, Televisions, Video Products and Consumer Battery Charging Systems

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: C381.2-17 means CSA standard C381.2-17 entitled Energy performance of battery-charging systems and uninterruptible power supplies;
CAN/CSA C381.2-14 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C381.2-14 entitled Test method for determining the energy efficiency of battery-charging systems;
CAN/CSA C62301-07 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C62301-07 entitled Household Electrical Appliances — Measurement of Standby Power;
CAN/CSA C62301-11 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C62301-11 entitled Household electrical appliances — Measurement of standby power;
compact audio product has the same meaning as in the federal regulation;
consumer battery charging system means a battery charging system, including a battery charging system built into another product, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has an input capacity of less than 2 kW, and
is distributed primarily for personal use by individuals,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: but does not include a battery charging system excluded under section 12;

E24, in relation to a consumer battery charging system, means the energy consumption of the consumer battery charging system, in watt-hours, over a 24 hour period when the consumer battery charging system is charging or maintaining the batteries;
Eb, in relation to a consumer battery charging system, means the total capacity, in watt-hours, of all the batteries in the system;
Ebatt, in relation to a consumer battery charging system, means the energy, in watt-hours, delivered by the consumer battery charging system;
N, in relation to a consumer battery charging system, means the number of charger ports;
PM, in relation to a consumer battery charging system, means power usage in maintenance mode, which is the state the consumer battery charging system is in when

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the consumer battery charging system is connected to the main electricity supply, and
the battery is fully charged, but is still connected to the consumer battery charging system;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: PO, in relation to a consumer battery charging system, means power usage in no-battery mode, which is the state the consumer battery charging system is in when

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the consumer battery charging system is connected to the main electricity supply,
the consumer battery charging system is not connected to the battery, and
each manual on-off switch, if any, is turned on;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: UEC, in relation to a consumer battery charging system, means the unit energy consumption of the consumer battery charging system expressed in kilowatt-hours per year, or kWh/yr;
video product has the same meaning as in the federal regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Excluded consumer battery charging systems
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of the definition of "consumer battery charging system" in section 11, the following are excluded:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an inductive battery charging system that uses

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: less than one watt in maintenance mode,
less than one watt in no-battery mode, and
an average of one watt or less over the duration of the charge and maintenance mode test as determined under section 5.8 of CAN/CSA C381.2-14;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a battery charging system incorporated into an uninterruptible power supply system that uses no more than 0.8 + 0.0021 × Eb watts in maintenance mode;
a battery analyzer or battery charging system for use in medical devices and exit signs;
a battery charging system built into another product, if the other product is an energy device;
a battery charging system that relies on solar energy or winding-up as its sole source of power.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for compact audio products, televisions and video products compliant with federal Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a compact audio product, television or video product if, in respect of the energy device,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the information required under section 5 (1) [information to be provided by dealers] of the federal Act has been provided to the federal minister, or

the manufacturer of the energy device provides a copy of the information required under section 5 (1) of the federal Act to an inspector designated under section 3 [inspection and testing] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for consumer battery charging systems manufactured on or after June 13, 2018
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for a consumer battery charging system manufactured on or after June 13, 2018.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Efficiency standards for compact audio products, televisions,
video products and consumer battery charging systems
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following efficiency standards table sets out the efficiency standards for energy devices that are compact audio products, televisions, video products and consumer battery charging systems:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Products manufactured between Jan 2, 2013 and June 1, 2018

Must be capable of entering each of the following modes that are applicable to the individual product: (a) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 1 watt, with information or status display active;(b) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, with information or status display inactive;(c) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, without information or status display;(d) an off mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts.
CAN/CSA C62301-07 tested at 115 volts, regardless of the nominal voltage of the energy device
Products manufactured on or after June 2, 2018

Must be capable of entering each of the following modes that are applicable to the individual product: (a) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 1 watt, with information or status display active;(b) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, with information or status display inactive;(c) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, without information or status display;(d) an off mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts.
CAN/CSA C62301-11, tested at 115 volts, regardless of the nominal voltage of the energy device
Products manufactured between Jan 2, 2013 and June 1, 2018

Must be capable of entering each of the following modes that are applicable to the individual product: (a) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 1 watt, with information or status display active;(b) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, with information or status display inactive;(c) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, without information or status display;(d) an off mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts.
CAN/CSA C62301-07, tested at 115 volts, regardless of the nominal voltage of the energy device
Products manufactured on or after June 2, 2018

Must be capable of entering each of the following modes that are applicable to the individual product: (a) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 1 watt, with information or status display active;(b) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, with information or status display inactive;(c) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, without information or status display;(d) an off mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts.
CAN/CSA C62301-11, tested at 115 volts, regardless of the nominal voltage of the energy device
Products manufactured between Jan 2, 2013 and June 1, 2018

Must be capable of entering each of the following modes that are applicable to the individual product: (a) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 1 watt, with information or status display active;(b) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, with information or status display inactive;(c) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, without information or status display;(d) an off mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts.
CAN/CSA C62301-07, tested at 115 volts, regardless of the nominal voltage of the energy device
Products manufactured on or after June 2, 2018

Must be capable of entering each of the following modes that are applicable to the individual product: (a) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 1 watt, with information or status display active;(b) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, with information or status display inactive;(c) a standby mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts, without information or status display;(d) an off mode with a power consumption of ≤ 0.5 watts.
CAN/CSA C62301-11, tested at 115 volts, regardless of the nominal voltage of the energy device

Consumer battery charging systems with Eb ≤ 2.5 watt-hours
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured between June 1, 2015 and June 12, 2018

E24 must be ≤ (16 × N) watt-hours
PM + PO must be ≤ (N + 0.0021 × Eb) watt-hours

Consumer battery charging systems with Eb > 2.5 watt-hours but ≤ 100 watt-hours
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured between June 1, 2015 and June 12, 2018

E24 must be ≤ (12 × N + 1.6 × Eb) watt-hours
PM + PO must be ≤ (N + 0.0021 × Eb) watt-hours

Consumer battery charging systems with Eb > 100 watt-hours but ≤ 1 000 watt-hours
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured between June 1, 2015 and June 12, 2018

E24 must be ≤ (22 × N + 1.5 × Eb) watt-hours
PM + PO must be ≤ (N + 0.0021 × Eb) watt-hours

Consumer battery charging systems with Eb > 1 000 watt-hours
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured between June 1, 2015 and June 12, 2018

E24 must be ≤ (36.4 × N + 1.486 × Eb) watt-hours
PM + PO must be ≤ (N + 0.0021 × Eb) watt-hours

Consumer battery charging systems with Ebatt ≤ 5 watt-hours that are designed for use in wet environments and have inductive connections
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured on or after June 13, 2018

Consumer battery charging systems, other than systems referred to in item 8, with Ebatt < 100 watt-hours and battery voltage of < 4 volts
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured on or after June 13, 2018

Consumer battery charging systems, other than systems referred to in item 8, with Ebatt < 100 watt-hours and battery voltage of ≥ 4 volts but ≤ 10 volts
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured on or after June 13, 2018

When Ebatt is < 10 watt-hours, UEC must be ≤ 1.42 kWh/yr
When Ebatt is ≥ 10 watt-hours, UEC must be ≤ 0.0255 × Ebatt + 1.16 kWh/yr

Consumer battery charging systems, other than systems referred to in item 8, with Ebatt < 100 watt-hours and battery voltage of > 10 volts
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured on or after June 13, 2018

Consumer battery charging systems with Ebatt ≥ 100 watt-hours but ≤ 3 000 watt-hours and battery voltage of < 20 volts
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured on or after June 13, 2018

Consumer battery charging systems with Ebatt ≥ 100 watt-hours but ≤ 3 000 watt-hours and battery voltage of ≥ 20 volts
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured on or after June 13, 2018

Consumer battery charging systems with Ebatt > 3 000 watt-hours
(for exclusions, see section 12)
Products manufactured on or after June 13, 2018

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions and interpretation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: ASHRAE means the American Society of Heating, Refrigeration and Air-Conditioning Engineers;
CAN/CSA A440.2-04/A440.3-04 means CSA standard CAN/CSA A440.2-04/A440.3-04 entitled Energy Performance of Windows and Other Fenestration Systems;
CAN/CSA A440.2-09/A440.3-09 means CSA standard CAN/CSA A440.2-09/A440.3-09 entitled Fenestration energy performance;
CAN/CSA A440.2-14/A440.3-14 means CSA standard CAN/CSA A440.2-14/A440.3-14 entitled Fenestration energy performance;
CAN/CSA A440.2-19/A440.3-19 means CSA standard CAN/CSA A440.2-19/A440.3-19 entitled Fenestration energy performance;
designated heritage building means a building that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on a Provincial heritage site within the meaning of the Heritage Conservation Act or otherwise included in the Provincial heritage register under that Act,
protected through heritage designation or included in a community heritage register by a local government under the Local Government Act,
protected through heritage designation or included in the heritage register by the Council under the Vancouver Charter, or
protected through heritage designation or included in a community heritage register by the trust council or a local trust committee under the Islands Trust Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: energy compliant building means a building that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is not a smaller building, and
meets one of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: ASHRAE standard ASHRAE 90.1 (2010, 2013, 2016, 2019 or 2022) entitled Energy Standard for Buildings Except Low-Rise Residential Buildings;
ASHRAE standard ASHRAE 189.1 (2014 or 2017) entitled Standard for the Design of High-Performance Green Buildings;
the National Energy Code of Canada for Buildings 2011, 2015, 2017 or 2020;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: larger building means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a residential building that has

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 4 or more storeys, or
floor space of more than 600 m2, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a non-residential building;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: NFRC 100-2004 means NFRC standard NFRC 100-2004 entitled Procedure for Determining Fenestration Product U-Factors;
NFRC 100-2010 means NFRC standard NFRC 100-2010 entitled Procedure for Determining Fenestration Product U-Factors;
NFRC 100-2014 means NFRC standard NFRC 100-2014 entitled Procedure for Determining Fenestration Product U-factors;
NFRC 100-2017 means NFRC standard NFRC 100-2017 entitled Procedure for Determining Fenestration Product U-factors;
residential building means a building with at least one residential unit;
smaller building means a residential building that has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: less than 4 storeys, or
floor space of 600 m2 or less;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: U-value means a measure of heat transfer expressed in watts per metre squared Kelvin, or W/[m2×K].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Door slabs referred to in column 1 in item 1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27 [efficiency standards for manufactured fenestration products]

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those door slabs that separate heated space from non-heated space, and
do not include door slabs referred to in section 17 [excluded door slabs].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Glazing products referred to in column 1 in item 2 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those glazing products that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are for installation in door slabs, sidelites or transoms, and
separate heated space from non-heated space, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: do not include products referred to in section 18 [excluded glazing products].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Non-metal, non-wood framed windows and sliding glass doors (for smaller buildings) referred to in column 1 in items 3 and 3.1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those non-metal, non-wood framed windows and sliding glass doors that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: separate heated space from non-heated space, and
are installed in smaller buildings, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: do not include products referred to in section 19 [excluded windows, doors, curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows (for smaller buildings)].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Wood framed windows and sliding glass doors (for smaller buildings) referred to in column 1 in items 4 and 4.1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those wood framed windows and sliding glass doors that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: separate heated space from non-heated space, and
are installed in smaller buildings, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: do not include products referred to in section 19.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Windows and sliding glass doors (for smaller buildings) referred to in column 1 in item 4.2 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those windows and sliding glass doors that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: separate heated space from non-heated space, and
are installed in smaller buildings, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: do not include products referred to in section 19.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Skylights referred to in column 1 in items 5 and 5.1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those skylights that separate heated space from non-heated space, and
do not include skylights installed in an energy compliant building.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Metal framed curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows (for smaller buildings) referred to in column 1 in items 6, 7 and 7.1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those metal framed curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: separate heated space from non-heated space, and
are installed in smaller buildings, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: do not include products referred to in section 19.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Non-metal curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows (for smaller buildings) referred to in column 1 in item 7.2 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those non-metal curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: separate heated space from non-heated space, and
are installed in smaller buildings, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: do not include products referred to in section 19.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Hinged and bi-folding doors (for smaller buildings) referred to in column 1 in items 8 and 8.1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those hinged and bi-folding doors that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are fully glazed into
separate heated space from non-heated space, and
are installed in smaller buildings, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: do not include products referred to in section 19.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Metal framed windows, sliding glass doors, curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows (for larger buildings) referred to in column 1 in item 9 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those metal framed windows, sliding glass doors, curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: separate heated space from non-heated space, and
are installed in larger buildings, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: do not include products referred to in section 20 [excluded windows, doors, curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows (for larger buildings)].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Non-metal windows, sliding glass doors, curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows (for larger buildings) referred to in column 1 in item 10 of the efficiency standards table in section 27

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include only those non-metal windows, sliding glass doors, curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: separate heated space from non-heated space, and
are installed in larger buildings, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: do not include products referred to in section 20.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Excluded door slabs
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 16 (2) (b), door slabs referred to in column 1 in item 1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27 [efficiency standards for manufactured fenestration products] do not include any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a solid wood door slab;
a door slab in a pre-hung door assembly with a maximum U-value of 1.80 W/[m2×K], tested in accordance with NFRC 100-2014;
a door slab installed in a designated heritage building;
a door slab installed in an energy compliant building.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Excluded glazing products
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 16 (3) (b), glazing products referred to in column 1 in item 2 of the efficiency standards table in section 27 [efficiency standards for manufactured fenestration products] do not include any of the following products:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a glazing product installed in a pre-hung door assembly with a maximum U-value of 1.80 W/[m2×K], tested in accordance with NFRC 100-2014;
a decorative glazing contained in a sealed insulating glass unit that has one or more stained glass panels, iron inserts or blinds;
a glazing product installed in a designated heritage building;
a glazing product installed in an energy compliant building.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Excluded windows, doors, curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows (for smaller buildings)
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 16 (4) (b), (5) (b), (5.1) (b), (7) (b), (7.1) (b) and (8) (b), the products referred to in column 1 in item 3, 3.1, 4, 4.1, 4.2, 6, 7, 7.1, 7.2, 8 or 8.1 of the efficiency standards table in section 27 [efficiency standards for manufactured fenestration products] do not include any of the following products:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a decorative window contained in a sealed insulating glass unit that has one or more stained glass panels, iron inserts or blinds;
a glazing replacement in an existing sash or frame, if the U-value of the replacement glazing is less than or equal to the U-value of the original glazing;
a window, curtain wall, window wall or storefront window installed in a designated heritage building;
a window, door, curtain wall, window wall or storefront window installed in an energy compliant building.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Excluded windows, doors, curtain walls, window walls and storefront windows (for larger buildings)
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 16 (9) (b) and (10) (b), the products referred to in column 1 in item 9 or 10 of the efficiency standards table in section 27 [efficiency standards for manufactured fenestration products] do not include any of the following products:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a glazing replacement in an existing sash or frame, if the U-value of the replacement glazing is less than or equal to the U-value of the original glazing;
a skylight;
a window, door, curtain wall, window wall or storefront window installed in a designated heritage building;
a window, door, curtain wall, window wall or storefront window installed in an energy compliant building.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Letter of assurance for energy compliant buildings

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 17 (d), 18 (d), 19 (d) and 20 (d), a letter of assurance that meets the requirements set out in subsection (2) of this section is evidence that a building is an energy compliant building.
The letter of assurance referred to in subsection (1)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be issued for the building by a registered professional of record, within the meaning of the British Columbia Building Code Regulation, B.C. Reg. 264/2012, and
may be in the form set out under, as applicable,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: Schedule C-B in section 2.2.7 of Division C of the British Columbia Building Code Regulation, or
the building bylaws of the City of Vancouver.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Placement of label on manufactured fenestration products

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 5 (3), an energy efficiency verification label must be placed on a manufactured fenestration product, other than a door slab, in one of the following ways:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by affixing the label to the frame or spacer bar of the manufactured fenestration product so that the label is visible at all times;
by affixing the label to the frame or sash of the manufactured fenestration product so that the label is visible when the sash is open;
by affixing the label as a transparent adhesive label to the glass of the manufactured fenestration product;
by etching the label into the surface of the glass of the manufactured fenestration product.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 5 (3), an energy efficiency verification label must be placed on a door slab in one of the following ways:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by affixing the label to the door slab so that the label is visible at all times;
by affixing the label to the edge of the door slab so that the label is visible when the door is open.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Additional label requirement for manufactured fenestration products

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 24, for the purposes of section 2 (1) (b) [prescribed label] of the Act, and in addition to an energy efficiency verification label and a manufacturing information label, a removable label that meets the requirements set out in subsection (2) of this section must be affixed to all manufactured fenestration products, other than door slabs and glazing products.
The removable label referred to in subsection (1) must set out the U-value, as determined by a designated tester, of a manufactured fenestration product as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for a single operator type, the overall U-value of the manufactured fenestration product;
for a combination or composite manufactured fenestration product composed of 2 or more operator types, each of which has a different U-value,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the overall U-value of the manufactured fenestration product, or
the individual U-value for each of the operator types in the manufactured fenestration product.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 (3) [energy efficiency verification label] applies to the removable label referred to in subsection (1) as if the removable label were an energy efficiency verification label.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for manufactured fenestration products designed for specific buildings

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a manufactured fenestration product, other than a door slab or glazing product, an energy efficiency verification label, a manufacturing information label and the removable label required under section 23 are not required if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the manufactured fenestration product is designed for a specific building, and
a certificate meeting the requirements set out in subsection (2) of this section is posted at the specific building site.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1) (b), the requirements for the certificate are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certificate must set out

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the U-value, as determined by a designated tester, for each manufactured fenestration product provided for the specific building, or

for manufactured fenestration products to which section 25 applies, the average U-value, as determined by a designated tester, for each type of manufactured fenestration product provided for the specific building;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certificate must be issued by a designated tester;

the certificate must be posted in plain view at the specific building site for a period of at least 120 days after the last of the manufactured fenestration products is installed in that specific building.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 35/2021, s. 11.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standard exemption for manufactured fenestration products designed for specific buildings
bcl:section.bcl:text: For manufactured fenestration products, other than door slabs and glazing products, that are designed for a specific building, if 2 or more of the same type of manufactured fenestration products are installed in the specific building, the applicable efficiency standard for each manufactured fenestration product of that type may be met by demonstrating that the average U-value, as determined by a designated tester, of those manufactured fenestration products meets the applicable efficiency standard.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Calculation of U-value for atypical manufactured fenestration products
bcl:section.bcl:text: For a manufactured fenestration product, other than a door slab or glazing product, for which the U-value, by reason of its atypical shape, size or other feature, cannot be determined by a designated tester using standard testing procedures, the actual size of the manufactured fenestration product may be used for calculating the U-value of that manufactured fenestration product.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standards for manufactured fenestration products
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following efficiency standards table sets out the efficiency standards for energy devices that are manufactured fenestration products:

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: CAN/CSA C300-M91 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C300-M91 entitled Capacity Measurement and Energy Consumption Test Methods for Refrigerators, Combination Refrigerator-Freezers and Freezers;
CAN/CSA C300-15 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C300-15 entitled Energy performance and capacity of household refrigerators, refrigerator-freezers, freezers and wine chillers;
CAN/CSA C360-13 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C360-13 entitled Energy performance, water consumption and capacity of household clothes washers;
CAN/CSA C373-14 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C373-14 entitled Energy performance and water consumption of household dishwashers;
clothes washer means a household automatic clothes washer that is electrically operated;
combination refrigerator-freezer means a household combination refrigerator-freezer that has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a defrost system, and
a capacity of up to 1 105 litres;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: compact clothes washer means a clothes washer that has a capacity of less than 1.6 ft3;
compact dishwasher means a dishwasher that has the capacity to hold up to 8 place settings;
dishwasher means a household automatic dishwasher that is electrically operated, but does not include a commercial, industrial or institutional dishwasher;
freezer means a household freezer that has a capacity of up to 850 litres;
refrigerator means a household refrigerator that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has a capacity of up to 1 105 litres,
has a defrost system, and
does not use an absorption refrigeration system;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: standard capacity clothes washer means a clothes washer that has a capacity of 1.6 ft3 or more;
standard capacity dishwasher means a dishwasher that has the capacity to hold more than 8 place settings.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for clothes washers, dishwashers, refrigerators, combination refrigerator-freezers and freezers compliant with federal Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a clothes washer, dishwasher, refrigerator, combination refrigerator-freezer or freezer if, in respect of the energy device,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the information required under section 5 (1) [information to be provided by dealers] of the federal Act has been provided to the federal minister, or

the manufacturer of the energy device provides a copy of the information required under section 5 (1) of the federal Act to an inspector designated under section 3 [inspection and testing] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standards for household appliances
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following efficiency standards table sets out the efficiency standards for energy devices that are household appliances:

bcl:part.bcl:text: Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning Products

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: AFUE means annual fuel utilization efficiency;
AHRI means the Air-Conditioning, Heating, and Refrigeration Institute;
ANSI Z21.13-2004/CSA 4.9-2004 means ANSI standard ANSI Z21.13-2004/CSA 4.9-2004 entitled Gas-Fired Low Pressure Steam and Hot Water Boilers;
ANSI Z21.50-2016/CSA 2.22-2016 means ANSI standard ANSI Z21.50-2016/CSA 2.22-2016 entitled Vented decorative gas appliances;
ANSI Z21.88-2016/CSA 2.33-2016 means ANSI standard ANSI Z21.88-2016/CSA 2.33-2016 entitled Vented gas fireplace heaters;
ANSI/AHRI 1500 means ANSI/AHRI standard ANSI/AHRI 1500 entitled 2015 Standard for Performance Rating of Commercial Space Heating Boilers;
CAN/CSA C828-13 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C828-13 entitled Performance Requirements for Thermostats Used With Individual Room Electric Space Heating Devices;
CAN/CSA P.2-13 means CSA standard CAN/CSA P.2-13 entitled Testing method for measuring the annual fuel utilization efficiency of residential gas-fired or oil-fired furnaces and boilers;
CAN/CSA P.4.1-02 means CSA standard CAN/CSA P.4.1-02 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Annual Fireplace Efficiency;
CAN/CSA P.4.1-15 means CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.4.1-15 entitled Testing method for measuring annual fireplace efficiency;
commercial gas boiler means a boiler that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is fired by propane or natural gas,
is intended for application in a hot water central heating system or in a potable water service, and
has an input rating of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: no less than 87.92 kW (300 000 BTU/h), and
no more than 2 930.71 kW (10 000 000 BTU/h);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: commercial gas boiler — large means a commercial gas boiler that has an input rating of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: more than 732.68 kW (2 500 000 BTU/h), and
no more than 2 930.71 kW (10 000 000 BTU/h);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: commercial gas boiler — small means a commercial gas boiler that has an input rating of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: no less than 87.92 kW (300 000 BTU/h), and
no more than 732.68 kW (2 500 000 BTU/h);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: CSA C828:19 means CSA standard CSA C828:19 entitled Performance Requirements for Line Voltage Thermostats Used With Individual Room Electric Space Heating Devices;
FE rating means the annual fireplace efficiency rating of a gas fireplace, vented gas fireplace heater or vented decorative gas appliance;

GAMA BTS-2000 means GAMA BTS-2000 standard of the Hydronics Institute Division of the Air Conditioning, Heating and Refrigeration Institute (USA) entitled Method to Determine Efficiency of Commercial Space Heating Boilers;
gas fireplace means a gas fireplace that uses propane or natural gas, including an insert or free-standing stove;
gas furnace has the same meaning as in the federal regulation;
HSPF means the heating seasonal performance factor, expressed in British thermal units per watt-hour or BTU/watt-hr;
outdoor gas furnace means a gas furnace that uses a single-phase electric current and is for use outdoors;
replacement gas furnace means a gas furnace for use as a replacement furnace in a residential building;
residential gas boiler means a boiler that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is fired by propane or natural gas,
is intended for application in a hot water central space heating system,
may service a potable hot water system, and
has an input rating of less than 87.92 kW (300 000 BTU/h);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: thermostat means a thermostat used for switching of a controlled resistive 120 or 240 volt heating load, but does not include any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a single thermostat used to control a central heating unit;
a thermostat in a portable heater;
a thermostat used exclusively to control

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a fan-forced heater,
a fireplace, or
a radiant floor heater;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a built-in line voltage thermostat used to control a baseboard heater, or panel convector heater, that has a maximum rated heat output of 1 000 watts;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: through-the-wall gas furnace means a through-the-wall gas furnace that uses a single-phase electric current;
vented decorative gas appliance means a vented decorative gas appliance that is within the scope of ANSI Z21.50-2016/CSA 2.22-2016;
vented gas fireplace heater means a vented gas fireplace heater that is within the scope of ANSI Z21.88-2016/CSA 2.33-2016.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for gas furnaces and residential gas boilers compliant with federal Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a gas furnace or residential gas boiler if, in respect of the energy device,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the information required under section 5 (1) [information to be provided by dealers] of the federal Act has been provided to the federal minister, or

the manufacturer of the energy device provides a copy of the information required under section 5 (1) of the federal Act to an inspector designated under section 3 [inspection and testing] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Label exemption for commercial gas boilers with
reported information or compliant with federal Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a commercial gas boiler if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the energy efficiency performance information set out for the energy device in the AHRI Directory of Certified Product Performance demonstrates compliance with the energy standard set out in column 4 in item 13.2 or item 13.3, as the case may be, of the efficiency standards table in section 34;

the energy efficiency performance information set out for the energy device in the United States Department of Energy Compliance Certification Database demonstrates compliance with the energy standard set out in column 4 in item 13.2 or item 13.3, as the case may be, of the efficiency standards table in section 34;
the information required under section 5 (1) [information to be provided by dealers] of the federal Act has been provided to the federal minister;

the manufacturer of the energy device provides a copy of the information required under section 5 (1) of the federal Act to an inspector designated under section 3 [inspection and testing] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: FE rating and label requirements for gas fireplaces

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An FE rating for a gas fireplace manufactured between January 2, 2007 and December 31, 2018 must be determined in accordance with one of the testing procedures referred to in column 5 in item 12 of the efficiency standards table in section 34.

For the purposes of section 2 (1) (b) [prescribed label] of the Act, an energy efficiency verification label for a gas fireplace referred to in subsection (1) of this section must set out the FE rating for the gas fireplace.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
FE rating and label requirements for vented gas fireplace heaters
and vented decorative gas appliances

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An FE rating for a vented gas fireplace heater or vented decorative gas appliance manufactured on or after January 1, 2019 must be determined in accordance with the testing procedure referred to in column 5 in item 12.1 or 12.2, as applicable, of the efficiency standards table in section 34.

For the purposes of section 2 (1) (b) [prescribed label] of the Act, an energy efficiency verification label for a vented gas fireplace heater or vented decorative gas appliance referred to in subsection (1) of this section must,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a vented gas fireplace heater, set out the FE rating for the vented gas fireplace heater, and
in the case of a vented decorative gas appliance,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: set out the FE rating for the vented decorative gas appliance, and
indicate that the vented decorative gas appliance is a decorative product and is not intended to be used as a heating appliance.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Placement of label on vented gas fireplace heaters
and vented decorative gas appliances

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person placing an energy efficiency verification label on a vented gas fireplace heater or vented decorative gas appliance referred to in section 33.1 must affix the label to the rating plate for the vented gas fireplace heater or vented decorative gas appliance.

For a vented gas fireplace heater or vented decorative gas appliance referred to in section 33.1 that is in a sales display, all of the information on the energy efficiency verification label for the vented gas fireplace heater or vented decorative gas appliance must be placed near that vented gas fireplace heater or vented decorative gas appliance so that the information can be easily and readily seen.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: bottom inlet has the same meaning as in the federal regulation;
CAN/CSA C191-04 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C191-04 entitled Performance of Electric Storage Tank Water Heaters for Domestic Hot Water Service;
CAN/CSA P.3-04 means CSA standard CAN/CSA P.3-04 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Energy Consumption and Determining Efficiencies of Gas-Fired Storage Water Heaters;
heat trap, in relation to a household electric storage-type water heater, means a device or pipe configuration that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is integrally connected or independently attached to the water inlet or water outlet of the household electric storage-type water heater, and

creates a thermal or mechanical seal to minimize the recirculation of water resulting from natural thermal convection between the hot water storage tank and the water inlet or water outlet of the hot water storage tank;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: household electric storage-type water heater means a water heater that has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a hot water storage tank that uses electricity to heat the water,
a top inlet or bottom inlet,
a rated storage capacity of 50 to 454 litres, and
an input rating of less than or equal to 12 kW (40 982 BTU/h);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: natural gas or propane storage-type water heater means a water heater that has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a hot water storage tank that uses natural gas or propane to heat the water,
a rated storage capacity of 76 to 380 litres, and
an input rating of less than or equal to 21.98 kW (75 000 BTU/h);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: responsible person, in relation to a household electric storage-type water heater, means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person who installs the household electric storage-type water heater, and
the person who has control over the installation of the household electric storage-type water heater in the premises;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: V, in relation to a household electric storage-type water heater or a natural gas or propane storage-type water heater, means the volume in litres of the rated storage capacity of the water heater.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for water heaters compliant with federal Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a household electric storage-type water heater or a natural gas or propane storage-type water heater if, in respect of the energy device,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the information required under section 5 (1) [information to be provided by dealers] of the federal Act has been provided to the federal minister, or

the manufacturer of the energy device provides a copy of the information required under section 5 (1) of the federal Act to an inspector designated under section 3 [inspection and testing] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Installation of household electric storage-type water heaters

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A responsible person must ensure that a functioning heat trap is installed with a household electric storage-type water heater, as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a household electric storage-type water heater with a top inlet, at the water inlet and at the water outlet;
in the case of a household electric storage-type water heater with a bottom inlet, at the water outlet.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A responsible person must also ensure that insulation with a minimum RSI of 0.70 m2×K/W, as determined in accordance with ASTM C518-10, is installed with the heat trap required under subsection (1), as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a heat trap that is integrally connected to the household electric storage-type water heater,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: on the first 3 metres of exposed water inlet piping upstream of the hot water storage tank, and
on the first 3 metres of exposed water outlet piping downstream of the hot water storage tank;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a heat trap that is independently attached to the household electric storage-type water heater,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: on the first 3 metres of exposed water inlet piping upstream of the hot water storage tank,
on the first 3 metres of exposed water outlet piping downstream of the hot water storage tank, and
on the water inlet and water outlet piping between the hot water storage tank and the heat trap.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standards for water heaters
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following efficiency standards table sets out the efficiency standards for energy devices that are water heaters:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Household electric storage-type water heaters having a top inlet and a rated storage capacity of 50 to 270 litres

Household electric storage-type water heaters having a top inlet and a rated storage capacity of 271 to 454 litres

Standby loss (in watts) must be ≤ (0.472 × V) − 48.5
Household electric storage-type water heaters having a bottom inlet and a rated storage capacity of 50 to 270 litres
Products manufactured on or after Sept 2, 2010
Standby loss (in watts) must be ≤ 40 + (0.20 × V)
Household electric storage-type water heaters having a bottom inlet and a rated storage capacity of 271 to 454 litres
Products manufactured on or after Sept 2, 2010
Standby loss (in watts) must be ≤ (0.472 × V) − 33.5
Natural gas or propane storage-type water heaters
Products manufactured on or after Sept 2, 2010

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: ANSI C78.79-2014 means ANSI standard ANSI C78.79-2014 entitled Nomenclature for Envelope Shapes Intended for Use with Electric Lamps;
ANSI C81.64-2005 means ANSI standard ANSI C81.64-2005 entitled Guidelines and General Information for Electric Lamp Bases, Lampholders, and Gauges;
CAN/CSA C239-94 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C239-94 entitled Performance Standard for Dusk-to-Dawn Luminaires;
CAN/CSA C654-M91 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C654-M91 entitled Fluorescent Lamp Ballast Efficacy Measurements;
CAN/CSA C819-95 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C819-95 entitled Performance of General Service Fluorescent Lamps;
CAN/CSA C861-10 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C861-10 (R2015) entitled Performance of self-ballasted compact fluorescent lamps and ballasted adapters;
CAN/CSA C861-95 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C861-95 entitled Performance of Compact Fluorescent Lamps and Ballasted Adapters;
CIE 13.3-1995 means CIE standard CIE 13.3-1995 entitled Method of Measuring and Specifying Colour Rendering Properties of Light Sources;
compact fluorescent lamp means a self-ballasted compact fluorescent lamp that incorporates a screwbase;
CRI means colour rendering index;
dusk-to-dawn area luminaire means a 120 volt input, 60 Hz luminaire that has a photocell controller and provides automatic dusk-to-dawn area illumination;
fluorescent lamp ballast for a 120 volt input means a fluorescent lamp ballast that is designed

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for a 120 volt input, and
to operate F32T8 rapid-start fluorescent lamps that have a CRI of greater than 75;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: fluorescent lamp ballast other than for a 120 volt input means a fluorescent lamp ballast in a fluorescent luminaire installed in an industrial, a commercial or a residential location, but does not include a fluorescent lamp ballast for a 120 volt input;

general service incandescent lamp has the same meaning as "general service lamp" in section 433 (1) [definition of general service lamp] of the federal regulation but does not include a lamp described in section 434 (2) (a) [limits] of that regulation;
IES means the Illuminating Engineering Society;
IES LM-45-15 means IES standard IES LM-45-15 entitled IES Approved Method for the Electrical and Photometric Measurement of General Service Incandescent Filament Lamps;
IES LM-49-12 means IES standard IES LM-49-12 entitled IES Approved Method For Life Testing of Incandescent Filament Lamps;
IES LM-65-14 means IES standard IES LM-65-14 entitled IES Approved Method for Life Testing of Single-Based Fluorescent Lamps;
IES LM-79-08 means IES standard IES LM-79-08 entitled IES Approved Method for Electrical and Photometric Measurements of Solid-State Lighting Products;
IES LM-84-14 means IES standard IES LM-84-14 entitled IES Approved Method for Measuring Luminous Flux and Color Maintenance of LED Lamps, Light Engines, and Luminaires;
IES TM-28-14 means IES standard IES TM-28-14 entitled Projecting Long-Term Luminous Flux Maintenance of LED Lamps and Luminaires;
modified spectrum lamp has the same meaning as in section 424 [definitions] of the federal regulation;
small diameter directional lamp means a non-tubular lamp that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has a diameter of not more than 57 mm,
has at least 80% of light output within a solid angle of π steradians,
has a base type of E26, G4, GU5.3, GU10 or GX5.3,
has a luminous flux of more than 150 lm, and
is designed to operate at a nominal voltage of 11 to 13 volts or 110 to 130 volts,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: but does not include a lamp excluded under section 39.1.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Excluded small diameter directional lamps
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of the definition of "small diameter directional lamp" in section 39, the following are excluded:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a multifaceted reflector shape lamp that has

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a first number symbol equal to 16,
a nominal input voltage of 12 volts, and
a luminous flux of 800 lm or more;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a reflector lamp that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: has a first number symbol less than 16, and
does not have a screw base type of E26/E24, E26d, E26/50x39, E26/53x39, E29/28, E29/53x39, E39, E39d, EP39 or EX39;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a multifaceted reflector shape lamp that is designed and marketed for a specialty application that has a rated life of not more than 300 hours;
a lamp that uses light emitting diode technology.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for certain lamps compliant with federal Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a compact fluorescent lamp or general service incandescent lamp if, in respect of the energy device,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: either of the following applies:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the information required under section 5 (1) [information to be provided by dealers] of the federal Act has been provided to the federal minister;

the manufacturer of the energy device provides a copy of the information required under section 5 (1) of the federal Act to an inspector designated under section 3 [inspection and testing] of the Act, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the manufacturer affixes to the packaging of the energy device the following information about the energy device:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the light output of the energy device in lumens;
the power consumption of the energy device in watts;
the CRI of the energy device;
the rated life of the energy device in hours.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Additional efficiency standard for fluorescent lamp ballasts

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a fluorescent lamp ballast for a 120 volt input, or a fluorescent lamp ballast other than for a 120 volt input, that has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an application of operation set out in column 1 of the table in section 42 [minimum ballast efficacy factors for fluorescent lamp ballasts],
a ballast input voltage set out in column 2 of the table in section 42, opposite the application of operation, and
the total nominal lamp wattage set out in column 3 of the table in section 42, opposite the ballast input voltage.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to meeting the efficiency standards set out in column 4 in item 1 or 2, as applicable, of the efficiency standards table in section 41, a fluorescent lamp ballast to which this section applies must also meet or exceed the minimum ballast efficacy factor that, in the table in section 42, is set out in column 4 opposite the applicable ballast input voltage set out in column 2.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standards for lighting products

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: CAN/CSA C390-98 means CSA standard CAN/CSA C390-98 entitled Energy Efficiency Test Methods for Three-Phase Induction Motors;
electric motor means a machine that converts electrical power into rotational mechanical power and includes any such machine that is incorporated into any other product;

enclosed motor means an electric motor constructed in such a manner as to prevent the free exchange of air between the inside and outside of the case, but the case is not sufficiently enclosed to be termed airtight;
explosion-proof construction means an electric motor

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for which measures have been taken to prevent the possibility of the electric motor reaching excessive temperatures or producing arcs or sparks, or
that is enclosed in a case that will withstand the explosion of any flammable gas or material that may enter the case, without being damaged and without transmitting an explosion outside of the case;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: general purpose electric motor means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an electric motor designed for usual service conditions, as described in section 44 (1), or
an electric motor designed for unusual service conditions, as described in section 44 (2);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: integral gear assembly means a product that is comprised of an electric motor and a gear mechanism that are combined in such a manner that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the end bracket or mounting flange forms an integral part of both the electric motor and the gear mechanism, and
if the electric motor and the gear mechanism are separated, only one of them remains intact;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: IP code means an alpha numeric sequence indicating the degree of protection offered by an electric motor's enclosure from foreign object insertion and water ingress, as defined in section 5.2 of MG1;
MG1 means NEMA Standards Publication MG1-2006, Motors and Generators;
NEMA means the National Electrical Manufacturers Association;
open motor means an electric motor with ventilating openings that permit passage of external cooling air over and around the windings of the electric motor.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: General purpose electric motors

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An electric motor designed for usual service conditions is an electric motor that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is designed for use under usual service conditions, as those conditions are described in MG1,
is not restricted to a particular application or type of application, and
meets both the standard operating requirements, as described in subsection (3), and the standard mechanical construction requirements, as described in subsection (4).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An electric motor designed for unusual service conditions is an electric motor that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is designed for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: use under unusual service conditions, as those conditions are described in MG1, or
a particular application or type of application,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may be used for most general purpose applications, and
meets either the standard operating requirements, as described in subsection (3), or the standard mechanical construction requirements, as described in subsection (4).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsections (1) (c) and (2) (c), the standard operating requirements for an electric motor are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the electric motor is designed to standard horsepower and speed ratings in accordance with MG1 or IEC 60034-1:2004;
the electric motor is rated for continuous duty operation or duty type S1, as defined in IEC standard 60034-1:2004;
the electric motor has a rated voltage of not more than 600 volts AC;
the electric motor has a rated frequency of 50/60 Hz or 60 Hz;
the electric motor is a NEMA design A, B or C as defined by MG1, or IEC design H or N as defined in IEC standard 60034-12:2007;
the electric motor is designed to operate at a single speed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsections (1) (c) and (2) (c), the standard mechanical construction requirements for an electric motor are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the electric motor is a three-phase electric induction motor of a squirrel cage or cage type design;
the electric motor has open or enclosed construction, including explosion-proof construction;
the electric motor is constructed to NEMA T frame or U frame dimensions, or to equivalent IEC dimensions;
the electric motor has a 2-, 4-, 6- or 8-pole construction;
the electric motor is of foot-mounted construction or flange-mounted construction;
the electric motor has an IP code from 00 to 66.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Type 1 general purpose electric motors

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the efficiency standards table in section 47 [efficiency standards for general purpose electric motors] and the table in section 48 [nominal full load efficiency for type 1 general purpose electric motors], a general purpose electric motor is a type 1 general purpose electric motor if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the general purpose electric motor is one of the following electric motors:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a close-coupled pump motor;
a vertically-mounted solid shaft normal thrust motor;
a fire pump motor;
a NEMA design B motor with a rated size of 201 to 500 hp, or an IEC design N motor of a size of 151 to 375 kW, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the general purpose electric motor has one or more of the following characteristics:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a U frame, or equivalent IEC dimensions;
a NEMA design C, or IEC design H;
a footless construction;
an 8-pole construction;
an integral gear assembly.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the efficiency standard referred to in column 4 in item 1 of the efficiency standards table in section 47, the applicable minimum nominal full load efficiency of a type 1 general purpose electric motor is determined by using the table in section 48, as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for an open motor with a rated power set out in column 1 of the table in section 48, the applicable minimum nominal full load efficiency is the motor efficiency set out in column 2

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: opposite the rated power of the open motor, and
in the sub-column that corresponds to the number of poles in the open motor;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for an enclosed motor with a rated power set out in column 1 of the table in section 48, the applicable minimum nominal full load efficiency is the motor efficiency set out in column 3

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: opposite the rated power of the enclosed motor, and
in the sub-column that corresponds to the number of poles in the enclosed motor.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Type 2 general purpose electric motors

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the efficiency standards table in section 47 [efficiency standards for general purpose electric motors] and the table in section 49 [nominal full load efficiency for type 2 general purpose electric motors], a general purpose electric motor is a type 2 general purpose electric motor if the general purpose electric motor has all of the following characteristics:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a rated size of 1 to 200 hp, or an IEC design motor of a size of 0.746 to 150 kW;
a 2-, 4- or 6-pole construction;
a NEMA T frame, or IEC frame designation of 90 or above;
a NEMA design A or B, or IEC design N;
a standard shaft, R-shaft or S-shaft or an IEC equivalent.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the efficiency standard referred to in column 4 in item 2 of the efficiency standards table in section 47, the applicable minimum nominal full load efficiency of a type 2 general purpose electric motor is determined by using the table in section 49, as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for an open motor with a rated power set out in column 1 of the table in section 49, the applicable minimum nominal full load efficiency is the motor efficiency set out in column 2

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: opposite the rated power of the open motor, and
in the sub-column that corresponds to the number of poles in the open motor;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for an enclosed motor with a rated power set out in column 1 of the table in section 49, the applicable minimum nominal full load efficiency is the motor efficiency set out in column 3

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: opposite the rated power of the enclosed motor, and
in the sub-column that corresponds to the number of poles in the enclosed motor.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standards for general purpose electric motors
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following efficiency standards table sets out the efficiency standards for energy devices that are general purpose electric motors:
