bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Part 9
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: ACPI means the UEFI Forum specification entitled Advanced Configuration and Power Interface (ACPI) Specification — Version 6.3;
CIELUV means a colour space adopted by the CIE;
computer means a stationary or portable device, other than a device excluded under section 51, that performs logical operations and processes data and, at a minimum, has the following components:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a CPU or the ability to function as a client gateway to a server that acts as a computational CPU;
the ability to support a keyboard, mouse, touchpad or other user input device, whether or not the device is included with the computer when the computer is shipped;

an integrated display screen or the ability to support an external display screen to output information, whether or not an external display screen is included with the computer when the computer is shipped;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: computer off mode means the computer mode defined in ACPI as "S5 Soft Off State";
computer sleep mode means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for a computer to which ACPI applies, the computer mode described as the "S3 Sleeping State" in ACPI, and
for a computer to which ACPI does not apply, a low-power mode

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that a computer enters automatically after a period of inactivity, or by manual selection, and

from which the computer can quickly wake in response to network connections or user interface devices within a latency period of 5 seconds or less from initiation of the wake event to the system becoming fully usable, including rendering of display;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: CPU means central processing unit;
defined Adobe RGB colours means the red, green, blue colour space developed by Adobe Systems Inc.;
defined sRGB colours means the standard red, green, blue colour space;

ENERGY STAR test method for computers means the test method set out in the document entitled ENERGY STAR® Program Requirements Product Specification for Computers — Final Test Method (Rev. March-2016);

expandability score or ES means a score that is determined under section 55 [expandability score for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients] or 75 [expandability score for high expandability computers, mobile workstations, small-scale servers and workstations];
GPU means graphics processing unit;
tanh means the hyberbolic tangent function;
TEC means total energy consumption;
UEFI Forum means the Unified Extensible Firmware Interface Forum.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Devices excluded from definition of "computer"

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: game console means a device designed and marketed primarily for video game usage and to which the consumer does not have the ability to add or remove system memory or a CPU;
industrial computer means either of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a process controller that is designed specifically to automate an industrial, medical or laboratory process;
a device that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is integrated into the chassis of industrial, medical or laboratory equipment that contains more than a computer, and
is designed specifically to perform logical operations and process data for an industrial, medical or laboratory product using product-specific software;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: small computer device means a computer system with an integrated and primary display that has a screen area of not more than 20 square inches;
small-volume computer model means a custom desktop or workstation computer model that is manufactured in quantities of not more than 50;
tablet means a device designed for portability that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has an integrated display with a diagonal size of less than 17.4 inches,
does not have an integrated or physically attached keyboard in its as-shipped configuration,
relies primarily on touch-screen input,
relies primarily on a wireless network connection, and
has and is powered primarily by an internal battery with connection to an alternating current mains power source for battery charging and not for primary powering of the device;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: television means an analog or digital device, including a combination television, television monitor, component television or any other unit marketed as a television, that is designed primarily for the display and reception of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a terrestrial, satellite, cable or internet protocol TV broadcast, or
any other broadcast or recorded transmission of analog or digital video and audio signals,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: but does not include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a computer monitor as defined in section 66 [definitions for Division 4], or
a television that is marketed exclusively for commercial use and is without an internal tuner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of the definition of "computer" in section 50, the following are excluded:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a game console;
an industrial computer;
a server, other than small-scale server as defined in section 72 [definitions for Division 5];
a small computer device;
a small-volume computer model;
a tablet;
a television.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Desktop Computers, Mobile Gaming Systems and Thin Clients

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Division 2
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: allowance for applicable adders means the sum of the allowances determined under the following in respect of each applicable adder for a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 56 [allowance for certain adders for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients];
section 57 [allowance for integrated displays for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients];
section 59 [allowance for first discrete GPUs for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients];

bcl:definition.bcl:text: applicable adder, in relation to a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client, means any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an adder described in section 56 (4);
an integrated display described in section 57 (2);
a first discrete GPU described in section 59 (2);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: desktop computer means a computer, including an integrated desktop computer, that has a main unit that is designed to be in a fixed location, but does not include any of the following as defined in section 72 [definitions for Division 5]:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a high-expandability computer;
a small-scale server;
a workstation;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: energy compliant power management settings, in relation to a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client, means power management settings that meet the requirements set out in section 60 [power management setting requirements for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients];
enhanced performance display or EPD means a computer monitor that has all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a contrast ratio of at least 60:1 measured at a horizontal viewing angle of at least 85, with or without a screen cover glass;
a native resolution of at least 2.3 megapixels;
a colour gamut size of at least sRGB as defined in IEC 61966-2-1:1999, with shifts in colour space allowable if at least 99% of defined sRGB colours are supported;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: IEC 61966-2-1:1999 means IEC standard IEC 61966-2-1:1999 entitled Amendment 1 — Multimedia systems and equipment — Colour measurement and management — Part 2-1: Colour management — Default RGB colour space — sRGB;
integrated desktop computer means a desktop computer

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in which the display and the computer are physically combined into a single unit, or
that is packaged as a single system and is powered from a single power supply but has a display that is separate from but connects to the computer chassis by a direct current power cord;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: mobile gaming system means a portable computer that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is used primarily for gaming,
is designed to be operated for extended periods both with and without a direct connection to an alternating current mains power source,
is sold or offered for sale with an integrated display and physical keyboard,
has a first discrete GPU with a frame buffer bandwidth of at least 128 gigabytes per second,
has a system memory of at least 16 gigabytes,
has an external power supply with a nameplate output power of at least 150 watts, and
has a total battery capacity of at least 75 watts;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: thin client means an independently-powered computer that meets all of the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the main computing functions of the computer are provided by a remote computing resource;
the computer does not have integral rotational storage media;
the computer is designed to be operated in a fixed location.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients with certification report
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a valid certification report for the device is listed in either or both of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the California Energy Commission Modernized Appliance Efficiency Database System;
the internet accessible directory of a designated tester, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certification report allows for verification that the energy standard set out in column 4 in item 1, 2 or 3, as the case may be, of the efficiency standards table in section 54 is met.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standards for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following efficiency standards table sets out the efficiency standards for energy devices that are desktop computers, mobile gaming systems or thin clients:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client with ES ≤ 250
Products manufactured on or after July 1, 2021

TEC must be ≤ 50 kWh/yr + allowance for applicable adders
Must be shipped with energy compliant power management settings
ENERGY STAR test method for computers
Desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client with ES > 250 and ≤ 425
Products manufactured on or after July 1, 2021

TEC must be ≤ 60 kWh/yr + allowance for applicable adders
Must be shipped with energy compliant power management settings
ENERGY STAR test method for computers
Desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client with ES > 425 and ≤ 690
Products manufactured on or after July 1, 2021

TEC must be ≤ 75 kWh/yr + allowance for applicable adders
Must be shipped with energy compliant power management settings
ENERGY STAR test method for computers

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Expandability score for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the table in this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: eSATA means External Serial Advanced Technology Attachment;
IDE means Integrated Development Environment;
PCI means Peripheral Component Interconnect;
PCIe means Peripheral Component Interconnect Express;
SATA means Serial Advanced Technology Attachment;
USB means Universal Serial Bus.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client that has one or more interfaces of a type referred to in column 1 of the following table, the expandability score is the amount determined by doing the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for each applicable type of interface referred to in column 1 in an item of the table,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: identifying the number of interfaces of that type the desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client has when sold or offered for sale, and
multiplying the number identified under subparagraph (i) by the interface score for that interface type referred to in column 2;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: calculating the sum of the products determined under paragraph (a) (ii);
adding 100 to the amount determined under paragraph (b):

oasis:entry.oasis:line: USB port or Thunderbolt 3.0 or greater that can provide ≤ 30 watts of power
USB port or Thunderbolt 3.0 or greater that can provide ≥ 30 watts of power and < 60 watts of power
USB port or Thunderbolt 3.0 or greater that can provide ≥ 60 watts of power and < 100 watts of power
USB port or Thunderbolt 3.0 or greater that can provide ≥ 100 watts of power
Unconnected USB 3.0 or 3.1 Generation 1 motherboard header
PCI mechanical slot other than PCIe x16
PCIe x16 or higher mechanical slot
M.2, other than M.2 key M
M.2 key M, SATA express, U.2

Either
(a) CPU and motherboard support for 4 or more channels of system memory and at least 8 gigabytes of installed and compatible system memory, or(b) at least 8 gigabytes of system memory installed on a 256 bit or greater memory interface

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allowance for certain adders for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: add-in card means a removable device that can be installed in a computer peripheral component interconnect or other slot, but does not include any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a hard-disk;
system memory;
a riser card or other card that splits or physically extends a motherboard slot;
an adder, other than an add-in card, referred to in column 1 of the table;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: C means the system memory capacity of the computer, in gigabytes;
S means the bandwidth of the system memory, measured in gigabytes per second;
storage device does not include main storage device.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Item 9 [add-in card] of the table in this section does not apply in relation to an add-in card that meets either of the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the allowance is claimed for an add-in card for a device connected through the add-in card;
an expandability score determined in accordance with section 55 applies to a slot or interface provided by the add-in card.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Item 12 [high bandwidth system memory] of the table in this section does not apply to an energy device that is a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client if the energy device meets any of the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the device has 4-channel memory that was taken into account in determining the expandability score for the device;
the device has a system memory bandwidth of less than 146 gigabytes per second;
less than 4 gigabytes of the system memory of the device has a bandwidth of 146 gigabytes per second or more and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the maximum resolution of the device's integrated display is 9 megapixels, or
the device does not have an integrated display;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the device uses a first discrete GPU described in column 1 of the table in section 59 [allowance for first discrete GPUs for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client that has an adder referred to in column 1 in an item of the following table, the allowance for the adder is the amount referred to or determined in accordance with the formula set out opposite in column 2:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Storage device with 8.89 centimetre (3.5 inch) drive
Storage device with 6.35 centimetre (2.5 inch) drive
Storage device with solid-state hybrid drive
Storage device, other than storage device to which item 3, 4, 5 or 6 applies
Wired ethernet or fibre card with a transmit rate of 10 gigabytes per second or more

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allowance for integrated displays for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the table in this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: A means the viewable screen area of an integrated display, measured in square inches;
EP value means the enhanced performance value and has the applicable value set out in section 58;
r means the resolution of an integrated display and,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the display has a resolution of not more than 6 megapixels, has a value equal to the number of megapixels of the resolution, and
if the display has a resolution of more than 6 megapixels, has a value of 6.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client that has an adder that is an integrated display with a diagonal measurement referred to in column 1 in an item of the following table, the allowance for the adder is the amount determined in accordance with the formula set out opposite in column 2:

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: EP value for integrated displays
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of the formulas set out in column 2 of the table in section 57, the EP value for an integrated display described in column 1 in an item of the following table is the value set out opposite in column 2:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Integrated display with colour gamut support of 32.9% of CIELUV or greater (99% or more of defined sRGB colours)
Integrated display with colour gamut support of 38.4% of CIELUV or greater (99% or more of defined Adobe RGB colours)
Integrated display that is not an enhanced performance integrated display

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allowance for first discrete GPUs for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the table in this section, B means the frame buffer bandwidth of the unit, measured in gigabytes per second.

For a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client that has an adder that is a first discrete GPU described in column 1 in an item of the following table, the allowance for the adder is the amount determined in accordance with the formula set out opposite in column 2:

oasis:entry.oasis:line:
First discrete GPU if
(a) GPU not packaged on same substrate as CPU, and
(b) computer manufactured between September 1, 2020 and July 1, 2021

First discrete GPU if
(a) GPU not packaged on same substrate as CPU, and
(b) computer manufactured on or after July 2, 2021

First discrete GPU if
(a) GPU packaged on same substrate as CPU, and
(b) computer manufactured on or after September 1, 2021

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Power management setting requirements for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The power management settings for a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client must do both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within 30 minutes of user inactivity, transition the desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client into

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the computer off mode, or
the computer sleep mode, which mode must the requirements set out in subsection (2) or (3), as applicable;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within 15 minutes of user inactivity, transition displays connected to the desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client into computer sleep mode.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client to which ACPI applies, the computer sleep mode must meet the requirements applicable to "S3 Sleeping State" in ACPI.

For a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client to which ACPI does not apply, the computer sleep mode must yield a power consumption that does not exceed the amount, in watts, determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line:
the greater of
(a) the system memory capacity of the desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client, in gigabytes, less 32 gigabytes, and
(b) zero.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Notebook Computers and Portable All-in-One Computers

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Division 3
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: 2-in-one notebook means a notebook computer

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with a clam shell form factor and a detachable keyboard, and
whose keyboard and display portions are shipped as an integrated unit;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: allowance for applicable adders means the sum of the allowances determined under section 64 [allowance for applicable adders for notebook computers and portable all-in-one computers] in respect of each applicable adder for a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer;
applicable adder, in relation to a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer, means an adder described in section 64 (4);

energy compliant power management settings, in relation to a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer, means power management settings that meet the requirements set out in section 65 [power management setting requirements for notebook computers and portable all-in-one computers];
mobile gaming system has the same meaning as in section 52 [definitions for Division 2];
mobile workstation has the same meaning as in section 72 [definitions for Division 5];
notebook computer means a 2-in-one notebook, mobile thin client, notebook computer with touch-sensitive screen or any other computer, other than a mobile gaming system or mobile workstation, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is designed specifically for portability and to be operated for extended periods with or without a direct connection to an alternating current mains power source, and
is sold or offered for sale with an integrated display and physical keyboard;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: portable all-in-one computer means a computer that is designed for limited portability and meets all of the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the computer includes

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an integrated display with a diagonal size of not less than 17.4 inches,
the capacity to connect to a wireless network, and
an internal battery that can power the main functions of the computer;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the computer does not have a keyboard integrated into the physical housing of the product in its as-shipped configuration;
the computer includes and relies primarily on touch-screen input, with optional keyboard.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for notebook computers and portable all-in-one computers with certification report
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a valid certification report for the device is listed in either or both of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the California Energy Commission Modernized Appliance Efficiency Database System;
the internet accessible directory of a designated tester, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certification report allows for verification that the energy standard set out in column 4 in item 1 of the efficiency standards table in section 63 is met.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standards for notebook computers and portable all-in-one computers
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following efficiency standards table sets out the efficiency standards for energy devices that are notebook computers or portable all-in-one computers:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer
Products manufactured on or after July 1, 2021

TEC must be ≤ 30 kWh/yr + energy allowance for applicable adders
Must be shipped with energy compliant power management settings
ENERGY STAR test method for computers

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allowance for applicable adders for notebook computers and portable all-in-one computers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: A has the same meaning as in section 57 (1) [allowance for integrated displays for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients];
add-in card has the same meaning as in section 56 [allowance for certain adders for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients];
B means the frame buffer bandwidth of the unit, measured in gigabytes per second;
EP value means the enhanced performance value of an integrated display and,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the integrated enhanced performance display has a colour gamut support of 38.4% of CIELUV or greater (99% or more of defined Adobe RGB colours), the value is 0.40, or
if paragraph (a) does not apply, the value is zero;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: r has the same meaning as in section 57 (1);
S means the bandwidth of the system memory, measured in gigabytes per second;
storage device does not include a main storage device.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Item 7 [add-in card] of the table in this section does not apply in relation to an add-in card that meets either of the criteria set out in section 56 (2).
Item 10 [high bandwidth system memory] of the table in this section does not apply to a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer that meets any of the criteria set out in section 56 (3).

For a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer that has an adder referred to in column 1 in an item of the following table, the allowance for the adder is the amount referred to or determined in accordance with the formula set out opposite in column 2:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Wired ethernet or fibre card with a transmit rate of 10 gigabytes per second or more

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Power management setting requirements for notebook computers and portable all-in-one computers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The power management settings for a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer must do both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within 30 minutes of user inactivity, transition the notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer into

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the computer off mode, or
the computer sleep mode, which mode must the requirements set out in subsection (2), (3) or (4), as applicable;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within 15 minutes of user inactivity, transition displays connected to the notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer into sleep mode.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer to which ACPI applies, the computer sleep mode must meet the requirements applicable to "S3 Sleeping State" in ACPI.

For a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer to which ACPI does not apply, the computer sleep mode must, unless subsection (4) applies, yield a power consumption that does not exceed the amount, in watts, determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line:
the greater of
(a) the system memory capacity of the notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer, in gigabytes, less 16 gigabytes, and
(b) zero.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a discrete GPU is present in a notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer, the computer sleep mode for the notebook computer or portable all-in-one computer must yield a power consumption that does not exceed the amount, in watts, determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the result, in gigabytes, determined for the value of "C" in the formula set out in subsection (3).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Division 4
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: allowance for applicable adder means the sum of the allowances determined under section 71 [allowance for applicable adders for computer monitors] in respect of each applicable adder for a computer monitor;
applicable adder, in relation to a computer monitor, means an adder described in section 71 (2);
computer monitor means an analog or digital device, other than a device excluded under section 67, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is designed primarily to display computer-generated signals for viewing by one person in a desk-based environment,
has a diagonal screen size of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: not less than 17 inches, and
not more than 61 inches,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has a pixel density of greater than 5 000 pixels per square inch, and
is composed of a display screen and associated electronics;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: computer monitor off mode means the computer monitor

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is connected to a power source,
is not producing visual information, and
cannot be switched into any other mode with a remote control unit or internal or external signal;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: computer monitor sleep mode means a low-power mode in which the computer monitor provides one or more non-primary protective functions or continuous functions;
ENERGY STAR test method for displays means the test method set out in the document entitled ENERGY STAR® Program Requirements Product Specification for Displays — Final Test Method (Rev. Sep-2015);
Eon_max, in relation to a computer monitor, means the maximum on-mode power consumption of the computer monitor, in watts, as determined under section 70 [Eon_max of computer monitor];
gaming monitor means a computer monitor that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is capable of adjusting the monitor refresh rate with the frame rate of the video content,
supports a continuously variable refresh rate ranging across a factor of at least 1.75 times the minimum refresh rate supported, and
may include incremental hardware-based assistance.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Devices excluded from definition of "computer monitor"
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of the definition of "computer monitor" in section 66, the following are excluded:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a monitor that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: can operate with a keyboard, video and mouse switch, and
is designed to be used in a server rack for use solely in a data centre;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a medical computer monitor;
an analog or digital device designed primarily for the display of computer-generated signals that is not marketed for use as a computer monitor or a television;
a television as defined in section 51 (1) [devices excluded from definition of "computer"];

a display with integrated or replaceable batteries, including an electronic reader, a mobile phone, a tablet as defined in section 51 (1) or a digital picture frame, that is designed to support primary operation without alternating current electrical power or external direct current electrical power.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for computer monitors with certification report
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a computer monitor if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a valid certification report for the device is listed in either or both of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the California Energy Commission Modernized Appliance Efficiency Database System;
the internet accessible directory of a designated tester, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certification report allows for verification that the energy standard set out in column 4 in item 1 of the efficiency standards table in section 69 is met.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standards for computer monitors
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following efficiency standards table sets out the efficiency standards for energy devices that are computer monitors:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Products manufactured on or after July 1, 2021

Maximum on-mode power consumption of monitor must be ≤ Eon_max + allowance for applicable adders Must not consume more than 1.2 watts in computer monitor sleep mode and computer monitor off mode, combined Must be shipped with a screen luminance less than or equal to 270 cd/m2, and manufacturer may ship with additional features enabled, even if they were turned off in testing Computer monitors with touch screen capability are allowed an additional 1-watt allowance per mode in modes where touch functionality is enabled
ENERGY STAR test method for displays

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Eon_max of computer monitor

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the table in this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: A means the size of the screen area of a computer monitor, in square inches;
r means the resolution of the display of a computer monitor, in megapixels.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a computer monitor that has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a resolution referred to in column 1 in an item of the following table, and
a diagonal screen size referred to opposite in column 2,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the Eon_max for the computer monitor is the amount determined in accordance with the formula set out opposite in column 3:

oasis:line.in:strong:
Column 2
Diagonal Screen Size,
in Inches

Column 3
Maximum On-mode Power
Consumption, in Watts

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allowance for applicable adders for computer monitors

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the table in this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: EPD monitor means an enhanced performance display monitor;
fast refresh rate gaming monitor means a gaming monitor with a supported refresh rate of 300 Hz or more that includes incremental hardware-based assistance;
MRR means the maximum refresh rate in Hertz;
OLED monitor means an organic light-emitting diode monitor.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a computer monitor that has an adder referred to in column 1 in an item of the following table, the allowance for the adder is the amount determined in accordance with the formula set out opposite in column 2:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: EPD monitor with colour gamut support of 32.9% of CIELUV or greater (99% or more of defined sRGB colours)
EPD monitor with colour gamut support of 38.4% of CIELUV or greater (99% or more of defined Adobe RGB colours)
Gaming monitor without incremental hardware-based assistance
Gaming monitor with incremental hardware-based assistance
Fast refresh rate gaming monitor with MRR less than 480 Hertz
Fast refresh rate gaming monitor with MRR of 480 Hertz or more

bcl:division.bcl:text: High Expandability Computers, Mobile Workstations, Small-Scale Servers and Workstations

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Division 5
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: energy compliant power management settings, in relation to a high expandability computer, mobile workstation or workstation, means power management settings that meet the requirements set out in section 76 [power management setting requirements for high expandability computers, mobile workstations and workstations];
high expandability computer means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a computer that has an expandability score of more than 690, or
a desktop computer that has a power supply of at least 600 watts and either of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a first discrete GPU that has a frame buffer bandwidth of at least 600 gigabytes per second;
a total of at least 8 gigabytes of system memory with an integrated GPU and a bandwidth of at least 632 gigabytes per second;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: IEEE means the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers;

IEEE 802.3az-2010 means IEEE standard 802.3az-2010 entitled IEEE Standard for information technology — Local and metropolitan area networks — Specific requirements — Part 3: CSMA/CD Access Method and Physical Layer Specifications Amendment 5: Media Access Control Parameters, Physical Layers, and Management Parameters for Energy-Efficient Ethernet;
mobile workstation means a high-performance, single-user computer that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is used for computation-intensive tasks including graphics, computer-aided design, software development and financial or scientific applications, but not including game play,
is designed specifically for portability and to be operated for extended periods with or without a direct connection to an external power source,
is capable of operation on an integrated battery,
uses an integrated display,
has a mean time between failures of at least 13 000 hours,
supports

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: at least one discrete GPU with frame buffer bandwidth of at least 96 gigabytes per second, or
a total of at least 4 gigabytes of system memory with a bandwidth of at least 134 gigabytes per second and an integrated GPU,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: supports the inclusion of 3 or more internal storage devices,
supports at least 32 gigabytes of system memory, and
has received 2 or more independent software vendor product certifications, or is being reviewed for 2 or more certifications;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: rack-mounted workstation means a workstation that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is designed to be rack-mounted, and
may be accessed

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: locally by direct connection to the workstation and display, or
remotely across a network by one or more users;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: small-scale server means a computer that meets all of the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the computer uses desktop components in a desktop form factor;
the computer is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: designed to be a storage host for other computers and to perform functions such as providing network infrastructure services and hosting data and media,
designed in a pedestal, tower or other form factor similar to those of desktop computers such that all data processing, storage and network interfacing is contained within one box or product,
designed to operate continuously, except while undergoing maintenance, and
designed for an industry-accepted operating system for home or low-end server applications;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the computer is not designed to do either of the following as a primary function:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: process information for other systems;
run internet servers as a primary function;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the computer is capable of operating in a simultaneous multi-user environment serving several users through networked client units;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: workstation means a computer that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is used for computation-intensive tasks, including graphics, computer-aided design, software development and financial or scientific applications,
in its as-shipped configuration, does not support altering frequency or voltage beyond the CPU and the manufacturer's operating specifications for the GPU,
has system hardware that supports error-correcting code that detects and corrects errors with dedicated circuitry on and across the CPU, interconnect and system memory, and
meets 2 or more of the following criteria:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the computer supports one or more discrete GPUs or discrete compute accelerators;

the computer supports 4 or more lanes of peripheral component interconnect-express, other than discrete GPUs, connected to accessory expansion slots or ports where each lane has a bandwidth of 8 gigabits per second or more;
the computer provides multi-processor support for 2 or more physically separate processor packages or sockets;
the computer has received 2 or more independent software vendor product certifications or is being reviewed for 2 or more certifications.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Label exemption for high expandability computers, mobile workstations, small-scale servers and workstations with certification report
bcl:section.bcl:text: An energy efficiency verification label is not required for an energy device that is a high expandability computer, mobile workstation, small scale server or workstation if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a valid certification report for the device is listed in either or both of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the California Energy Commission Modernized Appliance Efficiency Database System;
the internet accessible directory of a designated tester, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certification report allows for verification that the energy standard set out in column 4 in item 1, 2 or 3, as the case may be, of the efficiency standards table in section 74 is met.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Efficiency standards for high expandability computers, mobile workstations, small-scale servers and workstations
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following efficiency standards table sets out the efficiency standards for energy devices that are high expandability computers, mobile workstations, workstations, rack-mounted workstations or small-scale servers:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: High expandability computer, mobile workstation or workstation other than rack-mounted workstation
Products manufactured on or after July 1, 2021

Must have energy compliant power management settings
Must meet the energy efficiency ethernet capability standard set out in IEEE 802.3az-2010
ENERGY STAR test method for computers
Products manufactured on or after July 1, 2021

Must transition connected displays into sleep mode within 15 minutes of user inactivity
Must meet the energy efficiency ethernet capability standard set out in IEEE 802.3az-2010
ENERGY STAR test method for computers
Products manufactured on or after July 1, 2021

Must transition connected displays into sleep mode within 15 minutes of user inactivity
Must meet the energy efficiency ethernet capability standard set out in IEEE 802.3az-2010
ENERGY STAR test method for computers

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Expandability score for high expandability computers, mobile workstations, small-scale servers and workstations
bcl:section.bcl:text: For a high expandability computer, mobile workstation, small-scale server or workstation that has one or more interfaces of a type referred to in column 1 of the table in section 55 [expandability score for desktop computers, mobile gaming systems and thin clients], the expandability score is the amount determined in accordance with that section, as if the high expandability computer, mobile workstation, small-scale server or workstation were a desktop computer, mobile gaming system or thin client.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Power management setting requirements for high expandability computers, mobile workstations and workstations

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The power management settings for a high expandability computer, mobile workstation or workstation must do both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within 30 minutes of user inactivity, transition the high expandability computer, mobile workstation or workstation into

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the computer off mode, or
the computer sleep mode, which mode must meet the requirements set out in subsection (2) or (3), as applicable;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within 15 minutes of user inactivity, transition displays connected to the high expandability computer, mobile workstation or workstation into computer sleep mode.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a high expandability computer, mobile workstation or workstation to which ACPI applies, the computer sleep mode must meet the requirements applicable to "S3 Sleeping State" in ACPI.

For a high expandability computer, mobile workstation or workstation to which ACPI does not apply, the computer sleep mode must yield a power consumption that does not exceed the amount, in watts, determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line:
the greater of
(a) the system memory capacity of the high expandability computer, mobile workstation or workstation, in gigabytes, less 32 gigabytes, and
(b) zero.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Energy Efficiency Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 114, ss. 2 and 6.]
